title: How Digital Cameras Construct A Color Image

images.figText: An orange filter transmits some wavelengths of light while blocking others. Credit: P. Marenfeld (NOAO/AURA/NSF).

Tiny red, green, and blue filters are placed over the pixels of the image sensor in a digital camera. The camera receives light simultaneously through all three filters. Credit: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bayer_filter

contents.content: Digital cameras (like those in mobile phones) cannot see color. They can only measure the amount of light that illuminates the image sensor.To build a color image, we use filters. A filter is designed to allow only certain wavelengths (or colors) of light to pass through it. All other wavelengths (or colors) are blocked.
